summary: Antibiotic-resistant bacteria are one of the biggest threats to global health, sickening an estimated 2 million people in the United States each year. There is strong evidence that some resistance in bacteria is caused by antibiotic use in food animals (cattle, poultry, swine). We found gaps in FDA's oversight of antibiotic use in food animals and USDA’s and HHS’s data collection, among other things. For...
title: Antibiotic Resistance: More Information Needed to Oversee Use of Medically Important Drugs in Food Animals
